title: Business Analytics - Internship
company: Business Analytics McKinsey & Company
location: Business Analytics Internship in Bangalore at McKinsey & Company
description: As a business analyst intern, you will join a client service team for 8-10 weeks, contributing to workstreams to help solve some of the toughest challenges our clients face. And these aren’t just any clients—they're some of the most influential organizations around, from Fortune 500 giants to innovative startups. We will expect you to go the extra mile, delivering solutions that solve immediate problems and drive long-term change. And we’ll rely on your judgment and integrity to ensure our recommendations are effective and long-lasting. About the internship Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities: 1. Work in-person, in-office, or at client locations depending on team schedules. 2. Structure and organize ambiguous problems, tasks, and information independently. 3. Create and execute complex project plans with clear objectives and deliverables. 4. Use data, facts, and logic to make informed decisions under tight deadlines. 5. Synthesize diverse content (e.g., emails, articles, spreadsheets) into clear written or verbal communication. 6. Develop output-focused materials such as PowerPoint presentations, Excel models, and written documents. 7. Organize and complete tasks independently from start to finish. 8. Communicate effectively with individuals across varying roles and perspectives. 9. Collaborate across time zones using tools like Microsoft Office, Slack, Zoom, and email. 10. Prioritize tasks and manage time effectively in an autonomous, deadline-driven environment. 11. Adapt to evolving work demands and dynamic business needs. 12. Participate in mentoring and feedback to support both personal growth and team performance. Skill(s) required Data Analysis Decision making Effective Communication English Proficiency (Spoken) English Proficiency (Written) MS-Excel MS-PowerPoint Time Management Earn certifications in these skills Learn Effective Communication Learn Business Communication Learn MS-Excel Learn Power BI Learn Statistical Modeling Who can apply Only those candidates can apply who: 1. are available for full time (in-office) internship 2. are available for duration of 2 months 3. have relevant skills and interests Other requirements 1. Educational background: Relevant undergraduate degree in progress. 2. Strong organizational skills with initiative and follow-through. 3. Excellent communication skills in English and local languages, adaptable to different audiences. 4. Sound decision-making skills based on data, facts, and logical reasoning. 5. Ability to produce professional deliverables such as slides, models, and written content. 6. Exceptional time management in complex and fast-paced settings. 7. Flexibility to attend meetings outside regular hours or manage last-minute assignments. 8. Willingness and capability to work in varied and potentially challenging environments (e.g., factories, hospitals, mines). Number of openings 1 Editor’s note Information above is Internshala's interpretation and paraphrasing of what we found on the shared link. Conclusion Driving lasting impact and building long-term capabilities with our clients is not easy work. You are the kind of person who thrives in a high performance/high reward culture - doing hard things, picking yourself up when you stumble, and having the resilience to try another way forward. In return for your drive, determination, and curiosity, we'll provide the resources, mentorship, and opportunities you need to become a stronger leader faster than you ever thought possible. Your colleagues—at all levels—will invest deeply in your development, just as much as they invest in delivering exceptional results for clients. Every day, you'll receive apprenticeship, coaching, and exposure that will accelerate your growth in ways you won’t find anywhere else. About McKinsey & Company Website Deloitte, founded in 1845 and headquartered in London, is one of the world's largest professional services firms. With a global presence in over 150 countries and annual revenue exceeding $64 billion in 2023, Deloitte provides consulting, audit, tax, and advisory services. In India, Deloitte has a significant presence, offering expertise in digital transformation, risk management, and financial advisory. The firm works with major corporations and government bodies, helping them navigate complex regulatory landscapes and implement technology-driven solutions. Known for its commitment to innovation and sustainability, Deloitte is a leader in shaping the future of business strategy and digital growth. description: Jio apprenticeship program is a fixed term structured learning initiative that provides aspiring, young, and energetic individuals with the opportunity to work and learn with a designated team at Jio and gain practical skills and knowledge in a specific trade or function. In Addition to the technical proficiency, the apprentices learn valuable workplace skills and build professional networks, setting a solid foundation for their future careers. The program also aims to develop digital orientation and create future ready talent that would help India on its journey of Digital transformation. About the internship Selected intern's day-to-day responsibilities: 1. Handle customer calls and provide resolutions in coordination with L2 Engineers. 2. Monitor network and service touchpoints within the assigned area through NOC systems. 3. Track dashboards and performance KPIs. 4. Raise alerts within the team for any threshold-crossing events. 5. Monitor trouble ticket alerts and address basic L1 issues. 6. Coordinate with the circle team for fibre, utility, and related concerns. 7. Ensure timely resolution of customer problems as per TAT and SLA guidelines. 8. Maintain MIS reports and conduct analysis to support troubleshooting and improve NOC operations. About Myntra Website Myntra, founded in 2007 in Bangalore by Mukesh Bansal, Ashutosh Lawania, and Vineet Saxena, was acquired by Flipkart in 2014. In 2024, it reported revenue of about $615.7 million. Myntra is a leading Indian fashion and lifestyle e-commerce platform offering apparel, footwear, accessories, beauty products, and home d  cor through both marketplace sellers and in-house labels. It employs around 1,500 people and has launched new services like M-Now for quick commerce. The company has achieved EBITDA profitability for two consecutive quarters, cut return costs, and is expanding M-Now deliveries to major cities like Bengaluru, Mumbai, Delhi, and Pune.
